title: MongoDB Change Streams
subject: MongoDB
theory: Change Streams allow applications to access real-time data changes without polling. They rely on the Oplog.

examples.explanation: Fires events on insert, update, replace, delete.

common_mistakes.correction: Change Streams require a Replica Set (because they read the Oplog).
common_mistakes.example: Error: simple mongod doesn't support watch.

real_world_use_cases.description: Updating a user's UI instantly when a notification document is inserted.

summary: Change Streams enable reactive, event-driven architectures.
